page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS CONT
page.content: architecture becomes more modern,are inconspicuous bungalows and cottages. Behind some,are greenhouses.Today houses are everywhere,clinging to the valley slopes,scattered like sugarlumps on the cliff-tops and packed along the narrow roads.Only in a few places is the landscape as it was a century ago.Few of the farmhouses are working farms;most are dwellings,expensively modernized, selling at six figure prices, a reflection of the Open/Local Market system currently operating.One post-war estate,built on the site of a military barracks at Fort George is wholly occupied by well-to-do incomers.In this development, ill-proportioned mock-Georgian and neo-Hollywood Spanish hacienda-style rub shoulders with Suburbiton Executive in a curious mixture of
